reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really, really want to reccommend this. I do. But there's just too many issues.

Pros

A unique fighting experience that I've really enjoyed so far.
Interestingly mapped out story mode. Looks to have a decently long story.
I love the design in general. Of the game, and where the lore comes from as well.

Cons

The translation is god awful. It's really bad. There are some cutscenes where the text is in Chinese, when clearly english was chosen.

The game constantly flickers for me. It gives me errors about my graphics card, and as the game gets more intense, it becomes more impossible for me to play it. My setup is more than enough to run this game, so unless it's a compatability issue with nvidia gtx graphics (unlikely), I don't see the issue.

Very, very little options as far as changing visual settings go. Literally all that's there is an option to change the resolution.


I hope I can reccommend this game someday.

In case you're about to buy this, here's my rig :

Intel Core i7 4720HQ (2.60 GHz) 8 GB Memory 1 TB HDD NVIDIA GeForce GTX 960M 2 GB GDDR5 15.6 Windows 10 Home 64-Bit

If yours are like mine
date:
I would NOT reccommend this game to you.



"

reviewText:
I'm a fan of RTK (Romance of Three Kingdoms), so this totally appeals to me.
Furthermore it comes with very nice artwork, funny dialogues, and awesome music (definitely some parody here).

Gameplay is easy to learn, and I had lots of fun trying out different combos on my first try.
In short you bring a max of 4 characters with you from stage to stage like an arcade game, and earn coins" along that way
date:
which can be used to upgrade your characters to unlock additional skills to be used for combos.

I'm definitely sold here. Great game for a great price. 8/10

FYI
recommended: I'm playing it using chinese traditional

reviewText:
Played an hour on offline (Doing some system config) and currently playing online at the time of this review. (Also stuck on a certain level due to a Combo Condition)
+The game is actually an very interesting concept with funny artistic character designs taken from Chinese History and Characters from Romance of the Three Kingdoms. The only catch is that its like a parody with genderbender with some of them (Guan Yu&Zhang Fei are Female but not Lui Bei). Thus the reason you see chinese characters in the game itself.
+Its quite beautiful and alive especially the visual effects and its perspective view of 2.5 and 3D. Think of Muramasa: The Demon Blade game if you have played it on the DS or VITA.
+Don't worry for the game is fully in English with some funny translation but the Developers are Chinese so its bound to have funny translation.
+The Music is also quite amusing to listen since it fits the gameplay. The gameplay itself is situated as a button turn base where you choose the 1 abilities per turn per characters. You can score points by racking up the combo whilst dealing more damage and staggering the enemies so they can't counter attack. Its all about timing.
+The map is like Mario where you travel in each node.
-/+You can level up each characters with coins you earn from your travels though it will be grinding/farming since you need to level them up just to pass a level.
-/+To unlock characters you not only need to get through a certain part of the story but you need certain number of stars to unlock them.
+Gamepad is supported though I only tested using X-Input so I have no clue about D-Input.
-There are some minor bugs to be found though its nothing Game breaking.
-/+Some dialog when playing in English weren't translated but they will fix it next month.

reviewText:
Outstanding game! This truelly is a gem for all who love fast pase, thinking 2 steps ahead, cute cartoony character beat em up games... BUT! This game have a slight twist then the normal beat em up game...

There are no direct control of your hero's movement, they taking turns jump into then fight then withdraw when the next hero enter the battle, and the control have been split for both left and right hand...

Left hand WASD = Controlls the roaster of heroes in your team, game will auto rotate your heroes if no extra command was given, but you can use WASD keys to force select a hero from your roaster so you can unleash one of his skill that is not in cooldown.

Right hand IHJK = Controlls the 4 skills of each hero. J is the basic attack, that every heroes start with at lv1. K is advanced tier attack, and H is higher tier attack, Heroes unlock this 2 at higher level. I is ultimate attack, and also the last skill to be unlocked, they are not just dealing large amount of damage, they also laster way longer then any other attacks, and the lasting effect extend into 1-2 more heroes's turn.

The goal of this game is to plan and form combos with the attacks of your heroes, and use those attack to ether stunlock or push back waves of enemy, but enemy do have special ability or will be located at areas that some attacks just won't be able to touch them, so it will be up to the player to form up a team of heroes to bring down those annony buggers.

This game have a really fast gaming pace, really nice graphic for an indie game, funky cartoony design... It is fun to play, and even the music make me want to record it for my MP3 player!!


Okie.. I forgot to mention the down side... Due to this is a Chinese indie game, so far only some of the dialogues (most of them) and menus were translated into English, other in-game signs like Let The Battle Begin!"
date: "Show them what you can do!" and "Victory!" are still in Chinese... So it might be eyesore for some Internet Nazi
recommended: but not a big issue for normal game player. :P"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a good time/stress/boredom killer, the plot is typical but okay and the characters are very funny. The mix of action & strategy looks nonsense at the beginning, but as soon you progress you'll need to adjust timing to your attacks and use character types wisely and level them up accordingly. It's like a turn-based action rpg with side scrolling view.
https://youtu.be/TPym4LCKvMY
There a some yet-to-be-translated parts but it's safe to say the game is still understandable and only affecting further stages/less important parts of the game. Depending of your confidence to the devs, you may wait or support this title now and enjoy the game like many others have. I did not regret the amount i've spent. Some of you may differ regarding it's quality, but as far as i'm concerned the price point is acceptable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

i have always been wary of games like this, but i am glad i took the plunge and purchased it.

have only played just over an hour and i am thoroughly enjoying it. i like the links to the three kingdoms elements and enjoy the twist on that history and its people/events.

the game itself its only confusing for mere minutes as once you figure out team turns and moves you can come up with some ace combos and link attacks. as you level up your characters with the coins you gain from battles you gain more moves.and so far i have 2 characters that can use 2 certain moves in 1 turn which adds to the planning. another thing i have learnt is setup for moves. its worth noting range and where the move puts the enemy, as this can make or break a combo if the enemy is in the worng place for the next characters move.

as mentioned in other reviews there are a few tiny bugs and some funny translations, but overall an ace game thats worth much more than the current asking price.

reviewText:
Surprisingly good

Basically a parody of Japanese style games, over the top animations, over the top music
RPG elements, unlockable characters, good steam integration with cards and achievements
Overall good effort

Some minor issues, some parts untranslated and a lot of the translations are pretty bad, slightly shonky controls in places but still great fun

Edit: in late game the shonky controls are really annoying, sometimes pushing a button just doesn't execute the move (event though I started really slamming the buttons to make sure they are being pressed) even and it instantly ruins combos and just makes things super annoying

also they changed the world level menu and it's way worse than the original design

get the feeling they don't use play testers, but no worries, still a thumbs up as it's still fun and they are releasing updates regularly to fix little issues

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Attack Heroes is a stylish non-stop action game where the heroes take turns attacking. During a hero's attack friendly heroes can join with their helper attack if available. Also: cute anime style.

https://youtu.be/8-1R83Mg3S8

The PROS outweigh the cons
- Unique gameplay!
- Many enemy types
- Cute style with big Chinese text on the screen
- Fun enough story. 2 of the main characters have enough personality

CONS
- Just 4 girls in the game? And 8 guys . . .
- If you think you play a level, and then continue to the next level and continue with the story, no! You usually need to play the same levels again to complete challenges that are only available after beating the level once, and your character may not be strong enough to stand enough of a chance to beat the next level.
- Combo challenges can be literally impossible if your characters are too leveled up and kill enemies too quickly.
- The leveling up system plays a bit too much of a role for replayability: If you just want to play a much earlier level because it was fun, it won't be challenging any more.

Early Access Review

Only played for about 20min but I guess i understand the main things about this game.

The game is really fun and well crafted. Its almost like the Project X Zone" games for the 3DS. By that i mean that you controll a set amount of characters
date: you start with 3 and then as you progress you unlock more characters. You add or remove people from your group of 4 and follow a story based adventure where every stage is a combat scenario. Every character has 4 abilities
hoursPlayed: the ability gets a cooldown and you switch to the next character and keep the combo chain going. The game is quite interesting

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I will put it simply: IT IS EARLY ACCESS.

As my first EA game I decided to give a point form review for the developers to go off of. Here goes.

Pros
Amazing artwork.
High quality soundtrack.
Fun story.


Cons
Lack of real content for $8.
Short story.
Lack of deep RPG elements.

What is needed!
More diverse combos.
In-depth battle-system.
Alot more content.
A more diverse soundtrack.

The game itself is amazing but needs more than what it currently has. Keep working on it and it might be the One-Punch Man of games next to GodHand for PS2.
